edu.princeton.cs.algs4

Class BinaryStdIn

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.princeton.cs.algs4.BinaryStdIn

  • public final class BinaryStdIn
extends java.lang.Object
    Binary standard input. This class provides methods for reading in bits from standard input, either one bit at a time (as a boolean), 8 bits at a time (as a byte or char), 16 bits at a time (as a short), 32 bits at a time (as an int or float), or 64 bits at a time (as a double or long).

    All primitive types are assumed to be represented using their standard Java representations, in big-endian (most significant byte first) order.

    The client should not intermix calls to BinaryStdIn with calls to StdIn or System.in; otherwise unexpected behavior will result.

        Test client. Reads in a binary input file from standard input and writes it to standard output.
        Parameters:
        args - the command-line arguments

        public static boolean readBoolean()
        Reads the next bit of data from standard input and return as a boolean.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if standard input is empty

      • readByte

        public static byte readByte()
        Reads the next 8 bits from standard input and return as an 8-bit byte.
        Returns:
        the next 8 bits of data from standard input as a byte
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are fewer than 8 bits available on standard input

      • readChar

        public static char readChar()
        Reads the next 8 bits from standard input and return as an 8-bit char. Note that char is a 16-bit type; to read the next 16 bits as a char, use readChar(16).
        Returns:
        the next 8 bits of data from standard input as a char
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are fewer than 8 bits available on standard input

      • readChar

        public static char readChar(int r)
        Reads the next r bits from standard input and return as an r-bit character.
        Parameters:
        r - number of bits to read.
        Returns:
        the next r bits of data from standard input as a char
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there are fewer than r bits available on standard input
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless 1 <= r <= 16

        public static double readDouble()

        Returns:

      • readString

        public static java.lang.String readString()
        Reads the remaining bytes of data from standard input and return as a string.
        Returns:
        the remaining bytes of data from standard input as a String
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if standard input is empty or if the number of bits available on standard input is not a multiple of 8 (byte-aligned)
